author: julianfoad
msg: Simplify some merge code by using an existing function to resolve the source
URLs and revisions instead of trying to do sorta-kinda-the-same thing by
hand.
This would have a side effect of making svn_client_merge4() (the two-URL
merge) resolve a source such as 'wcpath' or 'wcpath@BASE' to the working or
base revision number of the URL of 'wcpath', which is not the same as using
the WC itself (which may be mixed-rev and/or modified) as the source, so
explicitly reject those cases where a WC path is specified with a working
copy peg revision.  Previously it threw a rather spurious error "E195000: A
path under version control is needed for this operation" in those cases.
The 'svn' client does its own error detection and reporting for those cases
since r1212463.
in svn_client_merge_reintegrate() we only supply a peg, and it is fine for
that to be a WC path with a WC peg revision.  The operative revisions are
determined automatically and can never be WC revisions such as 'BASE'.  In
svn_client_merge_peg4() we seem to ignore the fact that we can't read a WC
as a merge source and we actually have tests that rely on it: things like
'svn merge -rBASE:PREV mu'.
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(normalize_merge_sources): Take a resolved instead of an unresolved
revision number, to avoid resolving it internally, since the only caller
(merge_peg_locked) can now easily provide that.
(ensure_wc_path_has_repo_revision): New function.
(merge_locked): Use svn_client__ra_session_from_path() instead of in-line
code. Reject a source WC path with a WC peg revision.
(merge_peg_locked): Use svn_client__ra_session_from_path() instead of
in-line code.
